input.name: q
input.style: width: 180px; height: 21px; border: 1px solid #ccc; padding: 2px; *margin-top: -1px; background: #fff;

img.p: This is certainly a busy time of year as we are not only working on this year, but we are truly into planning for next year. On top of that, we are currently dealing with the Coronoavirus situation. I just wanted to provide some updates regarding some of the on-going topics in the district that were discussed at the school committee meeting last night:

1) CES Administrative Change: Mr. Rouleau has submitted his resignation from CPS to pursue another opportunity next school year. Additionally, he will be out for the remainder of the year for personal reasons. We thank Mr. Rouleau for his time at Clinton and wish him and his family well.

At this time Ms. Silvio has been appointed as the "Acting Principal". We are still working out the details of the full admin coverage plan for the remainder of the year; however, if you have a question or concern regarding CES, at this time you should direct it to Ms. Silvio.

2) Coronavirus - The School Committee voted to "cancel" the CHS April trip to Ireland and authorize me to work to find alternatives. We are currently trying to reschedule the trip for June. If that is not possible, students would have to take a voucher for future travel, or accept a partial refund. We will continue to work with local, state, and national agencies to monitor their guidance and best practice in order to respond to situations as they arise. The DESE and superintendents association are working collaboratively to continuously provide updates so that districts can learn and prepare from the various situations which have occurred around the state.

3) The school committee voted to accept the draft of the required Student Opportunity Act spending plan. The final version of the plan will be presented for approval at the school committee meeting on March 23. As a legal requirement of the Student Opportunity Act this plan must be voted on by the school committee and submitted to the state by April 1. This approved draft of the plan can be found here.
If you have any questions please feel free to contact me at smeyer@clinton.k12.ma.us or at (978) 365-4200.
